com.links.client
Class Timeline

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.visualization.client.visualizations.Visualization<Timeline.Options>
              com.links.client.Timeline
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.visualization.client.Selectable
public class Timeline
extends com.google.gwt.visualization.client.visualizations.Visualization<Timeline.Options>
implements com.google.gwt.visualization.client.Selectable

The timeline is a visualization chart to visualize events in time. The timeline is developed in javascript as a Google Visualization Chart. This Timeline class is a GWT wrapper for the javascript code.

Nested Class Summary
static class Timeline.ChangeHandler
          This class handles change events for the Timeline
 class Timeline.DateRange
          DateRange contains a start date and an end date

          Options for drawing the timeline.

Constructor Detail

Timeline

public Timeline()
Constructor

Timeline

public Timeline(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.DataTable data,
                Timeline.Options options)
Constructor

Parameters:
data - A google visualisation datatable containing the events. The table has three columns: startdate (type DATETIME), enddate (type DATETIME), content (type STRING)
options - A name/value map containing settings for the timeline. See the class Timeline.Options for all available options
Method Detail

redraw

public void redraw()
Redraw the timeline Remark: you can only use this function after the timeline is drawn once

addSelectHandler

public final void addSelectHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.SelectHandler handler)
Add a select handler. When the user clicks on an event on the timeline, the corresponding row in the data table is selected. The visualization then fires the select event.

Specified by:
addSelectHandler in interface com.google.gwt.visualization.client.Selectable
Parameters:
handler - A select handler

addRangeChangeHandler

public final void addRangeChangeHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.RangeChangeHandler handler)
Add a changerange handler. The changerange event is fired after the visible range changed by user interaction (moving or zooming), but not after a call to the setVisibleChartRange method. The new range can be retrieved by calling getVisibleChartRange method.

Parameters:
handler - A select handler

addChangeHandler

public final void addChangeHandler(Timeline.ChangeHandler handler)
Add a change handler. The change event is fired after the position of an event is changed by dragging it in the Timeline. The Change event can only occur when the Timeline is made editable (width option.setEditable(true)). The ChangeHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - A change handler

addReadyHandler

public final void addReadyHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.ReadyHandler handler)
Add a ready handler. The ready event is fired when the Timeline is ready for external method calls.

Parameters:
handler - A ready handler

getSelections

Returns a selection array containing the selected row

Specified by:

setSelections

public final void setSelections(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<com.google.gwt.visualization.client.Selection> sel)
Set a new selection

Specified by:
setSelections in interface com.google.gwt.visualization.client.Selectable
Parameters:
sel - A Selection array containing one selection. The timeline accepts only one selection element, which must have the property row.

setVisibleChartRange

public void setVisibleChartRange(java.util.Date startDate,
                                 java.util.Date endDate)
Set a new start and end date Use the function redraw() to redraw after changing the time

Parameters:
startDate - A Date object containing the start date.
endDate - A Date object containing the end date.
